Generate violin plot of QC metrics of each dataset

Source: R/qc.R
plotQCMetric.Rd

By default, a violin plot grouped by dataset variable, overlaid by a box plot would be generated. Options are available for adding jittered dot plot behind.

plotTotalCountViolin(object, groupBy = "dataset", ...)

plotGeneDetectedViolin(object, groupBy = "dataset", ...)

Arguments

object

liger object, or a data.frame like object of cell metadata, where "dataset" variable must exist.

groupBy

Group data by this categorical variable.

...

Theme setting parameters. Check .ggplotLigerTheme for more options and details.

metric

Metric to use. Should be found in cellMeta(object).

colorBy

Color the dot, violin and box plot with this variable.

dotPlot, violinPlot, boxPlot

Whether to add corresponding plot(s).

dotColor

Specify a color to set uniform color to all dots. Default "black". Set NULL then colored by colorBy.

dotSize

Size of dots.

violinAlpha, boxAlpha

The transparency of violins or boxes, respectively. 1 is opaque and 0 is transparent.

xlab, ylab

Title for x-/y-axis, respectively. Default groupBy and metric.

Examples

data("pbmc", package = "rliger")
plotTotalCountViolin(pbmc)

plotTotalCountViolin(pbmc, dot = TRUE, box = TRUE, colorBy = "dataset")
#> Warning: Duplicated `override.aes` is ignored.
